name: get_current_cycles
description: Retrieves details about the current development cycle(s), including name, start date, end date, and days remaining. Use this when asked 'what cycle are we in?', 'what's the current cycle?', 'when does the cycle end?', etc.

name: get_cycle_by_date
description: Finds the development cycle(s) that were active on a specific calendar date. The LLM MUST parse the user's requested date (e.g., 'July 10th', 'next Tuesday') into the ISO format 'YYYY-MM-DD' before calling this tool. Use the current year unless the date has already passed this year, in which case use the next year.

date_iso.description: The specific date to check for active cycles, formatted strictly as YYYY-MM-DD. Example: '2024-07-30'.

name: get_cycle_details_by_name
description: Retrieves the start date, end date, and days until start for a specific development cycle identified by its name/number (e.g., '1269', '2261'). Use this when asked for the dates or start time of a specific cycle number.

name.description: The name or number of the cycle to retrieve details for. Should be a numeric string like '1269'.

name: get_latest_cycle_completion
description: Retrieves the completion statistics (total completed dollars and percentage completed) for the most recently finished development cycle.

name: log_pto
description: Logs Paid Time Off (PTO) entries in TargetProcess for the requesting user. The function uses the user's Slack ID to find their TargetProcess ID. The LLM MUST parse the user's request (e.g., 'log PTO for next Monday', 'log PTO July 1-5', 'log 4 hours PTO tomorrow') and construct the 'pto_entries' array. Each entry in the array MUST represent a single day with its date in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format. Expand date ranges into individual day entries. If hours are not specified, default to 8.

pto_entries.description: An array of objects, each representing a single day of PTO to log. Each object MUST contain a 'date' (string, YYYY-MM-DD format) and MAY contain 'hours' (integer, defaults to 8 if omitted). Example: [{'date': '2024-07-29', 'hours': 8}, {'date': '2024-07-30'}]

date.description: The specific date for the PTO entry, formatted strictly as YYYY-MM-DD.

hours.description: The number of hours for the PTO entry on this date. Defaults to 8 if not provided.
